item.title:
R to @conduitxyz: Total cost of operations (TCO):
Two RaaS solutions may cost the same, but if one consistently innovates, pushes scaling boundaries, is always first to integrate new tools, etc. then it will save much more on TCO ‚Äì your true business costs ‚Äì in the long run.
item.dc:creator: @conduitxyz
item.description:
Total cost of operations (TCO):

Two RaaS solutions may cost the same, but if one consistently innovates, pushes scaling boundaries, is always first to integrate new tools, etc. then it will save much more on TCO ‚Äì your true business costs ‚Äì in the long run.

item.title:
R to @conduitxyz: Partnership:
As the nexus point of your chain‚Äôs infra, your RaaS needs to be a true business partner, not a transactional one.
The RaaS should function like an extension of your team: In the trenches with you, solving problems, advising on key decisions, and helping you scale.
item.dc:creator: @conduitxyz
item.description:
Partnership:

As the nexus point of your chain‚Äôs infra, your RaaS needs to be a true business partner, not a transactional one.

The RaaS should function like an extension of your team: In the trenches with you, solving problems, advising on key decisions, and helping you scale.

item.title:
We just published a guide to rollups-as-a-service platforms and recommend anyone considering building an L2 take a look.
Lots inside, but two points of RaaS evaluation stand out:
1) Partnership
2) Total cost of operations
item.dc:creator: @conduitxyz

item.title:
RT by @conduitxyz: Superposition mainnet is here and the best part is they are one of the first few Arbitrum chains to adopt Fast Withdrawals!
Withdrawal and gmeow from @Superpositionso as fast as 15 minutes.
Interop on Arbitrum is in full motion.
